headline: Super-Soft Coconut Cake
description: Who knew coconut cake could come together this quickly and taste so good?
recipeIngredient: Cooking spray or unrefined coconut oil, for the pans
3/4 cup full-fat canned unsweetened coconut milk (well-shaken)
1 cup sweetened shredded coconut, such as angel flake
2 tablespoons full-fat canned unsweetened coconut milk (well-shaken)
About 2 cups sweetened shredded coconut, such as angel flake

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Place 3 large eggs on the counter. Place 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter and 6 ounces cream cheese in the bowl of a stand mixer (or large bowl if using an electric hand mixer). Let sit at room temperature until the butter and cream cheese are softened.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1: Make the cake:
recipeInstructions.text: Coat 2 (8-inch-wide, 2-inch-high) round cake pans with cooking spray or coconut oil. Line the bottom of each with a parchment paper round.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2: Make the cake:
recipeInstructions.text: Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350ºF. If the unrefined coconut oil is solid, place 3/4 cup in the microwave and microwave in 30-second bursts until melted, about 25 seconds total.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3: Make the cake:
recipeInstructions.text: Place the coconut oil, 1 1/3 cups granulated sugar, 1/2 teaspoon coconut extract, and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract in a large bowl and whisk until combined, about 30 seconds. Add the eggs one at a time, whisking after each, until smooth.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4: Make the cake:
recipeInstructions.text: Add 3/4 cup coconut milk and whisk to combine. Add 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder and 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt, and whisk to combine. Sift 2 cups cake flour over the mixture. Add 1 cup sweetened shredded coconut and gently fold with a flexible spatula until just combined. Divide the batter between the two pans (about 4 cups or 36 ounces each).

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5: Make the cake:
recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 10 minutes. Rotate the pans and bake until a tester inserted into the center of the cakes comes out with a moist crumb or two, 10 to 13 minutes more.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 6: Make the cake:
recipeInstructions.text: Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes. Run a thin knife around each cake to loosen. Invert the cakes onto a wire rack and remove the parchment. Let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, make the frosting.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1: Make the frosting:
recipeInstructions.text: Beat the butter and cream cheese with the paddle attachment on low to medium-low speed until smooth, about 2 minutes. With the mixer on low speed, add 3 1/2 cups powdered sugar, one cup at a time, and beat until combined and smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2: Make the frosting:
recipeInstructions.text: Add 2 tablespoons coconut milk, 1/4 teaspoon coconut extract, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt. Beat on low speed just until combined, about 15 seconds. Do not overbeat.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3: Make the frosting:
recipeInstructions.text: Using a serrated knife, carefully trim the domed tops of the cakes if needed. Place a dollop of frosting on the center of a serving plate or cake stand and top with one cake layer. Top with 1 scant cup of the frosting and spread into an even layer, going all the way to the edges. Top with the second cake layer. Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining frosting. Sprinkle about 2 cups shredded sweetened coconut over the top and sides of the cake, pressing it gently into the frosting to adhere.

HowtoTip.text: Storage: The cake is best the day it is made, but will last lightly wrapped in plastic wrap in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Let come to room temperature before serving.To freeze, place the frosted cake in the freezer until frozen solid. Wrap the cake tightly in plastic wrap and freeze for up to 1 month. Thaw uncovered in the refrigerator overnight and then let come to room temperature before serving.

name: Super-Soft Coconut Cake

author.name: Jessie Sheehan
author.description: Jessie is the author of The Vintage Baker and Icebox Cakes. Her new easy-peasy baking book, Snackable Bakes, hits shelves in spring 2022. She contributes to the Washington Post, Bon Appétit, Food Network, Food52, Fine Cooking, and Parents magazine.
